Description: A hippopotamus ivory bangle: triangular in section, sloping to a pointed ridge around the outer circumference but flat on the inner face. Part of the surface has flaked away on both faces of the bangle.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Mostagedda, 408 The piece was found on the left wrist of a child
Curator's comments: Also from the burial: bead (1929,1015.10) and bracelet (1929,1015.8). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 5, 29; pl. XIII, 22; Grave register, pl. VII.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (7)
